item.description:
Rick Sammon Canon Explorer of Light

Saturday
March 31, 2012

9:00AM – Noon
Boston University
765 Commonwealth Ave. Room B50

(Entrance on Granby Street)

Free and open to the public!

Limited seating: Priority access seating before 8:40 with a reservation. Reservations limited to 100 seats out of approximate 150 seats. Without reservations, access om 8:40 to 9:00 or until room capacity reached. Email reservation to: wink8@mindspring.com. Reservation deadline, March 23.

Sponsored by:
NE W TO N C A M E R A C LUB
Where photographers click

Rick Sammon, a Canon Explorer of Light, is one of
the most active photographers on the planet. The dude
just can’t sit still!

Rick has published 36 paper books, including Secrets
of HDR Photography, Exploring the Light, and Digital
Photography Secrets.

Rick is also a leader in iPad and iPhone photography apps.
Rick’s book, Flying Flowers won the coveted Golden Light
Award, and his book Hide and See Under the Sea won the

Rick, who has photographed in almost 100 countries
does photography workshops (including private workshops) and
presentations around the world each year.
podcast (www.dpexperience.com) with Juan Pons.

Rick also hosts several shows on kelbytraining.com and

Rick, who has been nominated for the Photoshop Hall
RI experts, cutting through lots of Photoshop “speak,”
making it fun, easy and rewarding to work and play in
the digital darkroom.

See www.ricksammon.info for more information.

WWW.NEWTONCC.ORG or WWW.BOSTONCAMERACLUB.ORG

 

Limited Seating for this special event: priority access before 8:40 with a reservation. Reservations are limited to 100 seats out of about 150 seats total. Without reservations, access from 8:40 to 9:00 or until room capacity is reached. Email your reservation to wink8@mindspring.com. Reservation dadline: March 3.
